channel.title: [Delta] Making NPCs talk [Overhead]
channel.description: Okay so here's the problem, I have a server that's based off of delta. The problem is that when I try to add a code that makes NPCs talk I get errors. I know delta has a different "template" for making NPCs talk. Does anyone know what it is?

item.title: [Delta] Making NPCs talk [Overhead]
item.dc:creator: @Unknown_Supreme Unknown Supreme
item.description:
@Unknown_Supreme wrote:

[quote=“Telenim, post:8, topic:290983”]Try something like this then

if (npcs[i].npcType == 541) { if (misc.random2(20) == 1) { npcs.updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdate = "Your message here"; }[/quote]

I’ve got it to the point it doesn’t give me errors, but the NPC still isn’t talking.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Making NPCs talk [Overhead]
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

Try something like this then

if (npcs[i].npcType == 541) { if (misc.random2(20) == 1) { npcs.updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdate = "Your message here"; }

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Making NPCs talk [Overhead]
item.dc:creator: @Unknown_Supreme Unknown Supreme
item.description:
@Unknown_Supreme wrote:

Telenim:

You’re putting it at the bottom of the NPCHandler class? I have no idea what that error means, but it also might be because you haven’t entered an NPC ID.

Actually I have, the 1055.

Also, I really don’t know where to put it. As I cannot simply search for “moo” and find the place.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim

@Telenim wrote:

You’re putting it at the bottom of the NPCHandler class? I have no idea what that error means, but it also might be because you haven’t entered an NPC ID.

item.title: [Delta] Making NPCs talk [Overhead]
item.dc:creator: @Unknown_Supreme Unknown Supreme
item.description:
@Unknown_Supreme wrote:

Same problem when I compile

NPCHandler.java:3188: class, interface, or enum expected if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1055) { ^ NPCHandler.java:3191: class, interface, or enum expected npcs[NPCID].textUpdateRequired = true; ^ NPCHandler.java:3192: class, interface, or enum expected npcs[NPCID].textUpdate = "Your message here"; ^ NPCHandler.java:3193: class, interface, or enum expected }→ ^ 4 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Making NPCs talk [Overhead]
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

[quote=“Unknown Supreme, post:3, topic:290983”]which probably means I’m looking in the wrong place or I’m just not looking hard enough.[/quote]/Or doesn’t exist, and yes it should be something like that.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Making NPCs talk [Overhead]
item.dc:creator: @Unknown_Supreme Unknown Supreme
item.description:
@Unknown_Supreme wrote:

`Rich:

there’s no different “template”, just the variable is slightly renamed, look in the npc class to locate it

I’ve tried that and not found anything, which probably means I’m looking in the wrong place or I’m just not looking hard enough.

This is what I used to use.

if (npcs.npcType == 170) { if (misc.random2(20) == 1) { npcs.updateRequired = true; npcs.textUpdateRequired = true; npcs.textUpdate = "Your message here"; }

So would it be something like

if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 170) { if (misc.random2(20) == 1) { npcs.updateRequired = true; npcs.textUpdateRequired = true; npcs.textUpdate = "Your message here"; }

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Making NPCs talk [Overhead]
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

there’s no different “template”, just the variable is slightly renamed, look in the npc class to locate it

Read full topic
